intro: Dalrympelea javanica, commonly known as the Javanese dalrympelea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It has opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Dalrympelea javanica is often found in forest understories and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
